title: phpunit.xml inconsistency
body:
So I'm using a `phpunit.xml` to bootstrap my tests. I tried to trim it down - to keep it simple.

```
till@till-laptop:~/foo$ phpunit --configuration trunk/tests/phpunit.xml 

Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'RuntimeException' with message 'Cannot open file "./AllTests.php".
' in /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/Util/Fileloader.php:77
Stack trace:
#0 /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/Framework/TestSuite.php(369): PHPUnit_Util_Fileloader::checkAndLoad('./AllTests.php', true)
#1 /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/Util/Configuration.php(766): PHPUnit_Framework_TestSuite->addTestFile('./AllTests.php', true)
#2 /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/Util/Configuration.php(701): PHPUnit_Util_Configuration->getTestSuite(Object(DOMElement), true)
#3 /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php(666): PHPUnit_Util_Configuration->getTestSuiteConfiguration(true)
#4 /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php(138): PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->handleArguments(Array)
#5 /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php(129): PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->run(Array, true)
#6 /usr/local/bin/phpunit(53): PHPUnit_TextUI_Command::main()
#7 {main}
  thrown in /usr/local/pear/PHPUnit/Util/Fileloader.php on line 77
```

My phpunit.xml:

```
<phpunit colors="true" syntaxCheck="true">
    <testsuite name="TestSuite">
        <file>./AllTests.php</file>
    </testsuite>
</phpunit>
```

It works when I cd into the `tests` dir and execute phpunit from there.

I also tried `AllTests.php` without the `./` -- no dice.

This behaviour doesn't make any sense to me though. It always seems like the _base_ is where I execute `phpunit` from. Is there a way to fix this, or make `phpunit.xml` more robust.

By the way, I think this is inconsistent not just because it breaks when you're not in the same directory, but for example when I use `bootstrap="foo.php"` in my `phpunit.xml`, it finds `foo.php` inside my `tests` directory regardless of where I run `phpunit` from.

Using `3.5.14`.
